channel.title: Arcanum
channel.description: ** working title, bound to change! [size=14pt][b]About[/b][/size] [b]Server:[/b] 317: blakeman8192's [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,462049]RuneSource[/url] (not using a derivative such as Azure, etc.) [b]Client:[/b] 317 with 377 cache: mitb's packaged/renamed client found [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/srcPackaged.tar.gz]here[/url]. Uses parts of a 377 deob (fullscreen interfaces, etc.) [size=14pt][b]Who is Arcanum?[/b][/size] [ul][li]only [b]Hidendra[/b] at the moment :-([/li][/ul] [size=14pt][b]Core Progress[/b][/size] [ul][li]Scripting (JRuby)[/li] [li]JDBC data storage (MySQL + Stored Procs at the moment)[/li] [li]Deep logging and tracking [list] [li]Tracking traded items[/li] [li]Tracking NPC & Player drops[/li] [li]Possibly track hotspots - track session times, locations, activities performed, etc. Pretty graphs![/li] [/list][/li] [li]Shops [list] [li]Normal shops[/li] [li]General shops[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Banking [list] [li]Insert & swap modes both work as they should[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Trading[/li] [li]Ground Items - automatic disappearing and owner management [list][li]Picking up items[/li][li]Dropping items[/li][/list][/li] [li]Utilization of the JAGGRAB & Ondemand protocols[/li] [li]Login block encryption[/li] [li]Secure object interactions - only accept object clicks on [b]valid objects[/b]. Uses the cache (No way I would manually find each object's location!)[/li] [li]No X-LOGGING - if a player logs out and they were busy, they will still remain in the world for a period of time. This same feature also allows clients to reconnect if they are disconnected from the game due to connection issues without logging back in[/li][/ul] [size=14pt][b]Skill Progress[/b][/size] [ul][li][img]http://www.global-rs.com/images/skills/woodcutting.png[/img] Woodcutting [list] [li]Replace cut trees with a stump that cannot be chopped (even by hack clients)[/li] [li]More accurate formulas for calculating the chance of a player chopping a log[/li] [/list][/li] [li][img]http://www.global-rs.com/images/skills/mining.png[/img] Mining [list] [li]Replace mined rocks with an empty ore that cannot be mined (even by hack clients) depending on the rock you mine[/li] [li]More accurate formulas for calculating the chance of a player mining an ore[/li] [/list][/li][/ul] [size=14pt][b]Client Progress[/b][/size] [ul][li]Restore JAGGRAB, Ondemand, and RSA support[/li] [li][color=green]Fixed loading of head icons for prayer & skulls [list][li]Fullscreen interfaces, to support the Fullscreen Welcome Screen from the 377 cache[/li] [li]Allow k/m/b in Amount X interfaces (client side). E.g 5500k = 5500000, 5.5m = 5500000, 0.0055b = 5500000[/li] [/list][/li][/ul] [size=14pt][b]Media[/b][/size] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3xEcuyAEeVg[/youtube] Development video released October 15 [img]http://i.imgur.com/i86tt.png[/img] Text is set by the client. Server just sends numbers in a packet (how many days ago you logged in, days ago since pass change, days of members left, if the world you're in is a members world, ETC!), just like the real server. [img]http://i.imgur.com/FRyLd.png[/img] Sparkly fireworks, too! [img]http://i.imgur.com/MmxW9.png[/img] I'm loaded! Don't tell anyone, though >.> [img]http://i.imgur.com/1dXfJ.png[/img] Mining! [img]http://i.imgur.com/dWHv5.png[/img] All is well! The fine citizens of Gielinor have finally come out of hiding and judging by the enthusiastic guards walking inconspicuously in the background, it appears they are enjoying their time! It appears that a glitch in what must be related to the teleportation matrix has allowed everyone to walk through matter as if it weren't there! I can assure you however that our finest elves are checking on this strange issue! [size=14pt][b]Update Log[/b][/size] (may be outdated, it's a copy of my personal update log from github, so it has to be converted from markdown which is tedious (markdown -> html -> bbcode!)) [b]October 15[/b] [ul][li]Completed shops [list][li]Each shop is defined & initialized in Ruby (so a script reload = shops reset to the default at the moment)[/li][/list][/li][/ul] [b]October 13[/b] [ul][li]Added npc interaction hooks[/li] [li]Started shops[/li] [li]Fixed some misc hooks[/li][/ul] [b]October 12[/b] [ul][li]NPCs! RuneSource had a couple bugs where NPCs would both not spawn and refuse to walk. I've taught them a couple of lessons, however. :)[/li] [li]NPC random walking, for those that should roam! Random, too![/li][/ul] [b]October 11[/b] [ul][li]Mining. Will still need a lot of fine tuning, but almost every rock should work as it should.[/li] [li]Energy replenishment: Based on research using real RuneScape data, a formula has been devised that calculates how often energy restores for any given agility level[/li] [li]Energy loss: Based on research, again from RuneScape, the relationship between weights and energy loss was approximated. I did this years ago in the other Arcanum, but had to do it again. It is close enough to RuneScape's that you wouldn't notice the difference ;)[/li][/ul] [b]October 10[/b] [ul][li][b]Woodcutting[/b]! [list][li]100% Ruby[/li] [li]All trees very easily supported [b]without[/b] using any object Ids[/li] [li]All trees are not yet supported: more research needs to be done on formulas[/li] [li]The same code is what will support Mining and also Fishing.[/li][/list][/li] [li]Level up messages, interfaces, and graphic sparkles[/li] [li]Created a region system for temporary global objects[/li] [li]Some bug fixes for banking (fix deposit-all for non-noted items and withdraw-All for noted items)[/li][/ul] [b]October 9[/b] [ul][li]Climb ladders properly (using an animation and 2 tick delay)[/li] [li]Added support for animations & facing the player towards a specific coordinate[/li] [li]Allow m/k/b to be used in Enter Amount. e.g, if you enter 5500k, it sends 5500000 instead. Or if you type 5.5m, it does the same thing as 5500k. Or if you're brave, 0.0055b :p[/li][/ul] [b]October 8[/b] [ul][li][b]Banking[/b] [list][li]Saving to the database[/li] [li]Withdrawl modes: withdraw as note or item.[/li] [li]Insert modes: Both Insert and Swap modes work correctly[/li] [li]Fills in empty spaces in the bank when it is closed[/li][/list][/li] [li]Containers were not being cloned properly[/li] [li]Universal script that makes every staircase & ladder work correctly (no animations or "climb" interface yet). Uses data from the cache to know which option they used[/li] [li]Fixed location data loading [/li] [li]Object actions 2 & 3[/li][/ul] [b]October 7[/b] [ul][li]Implemented the ability to move items in interfaces (just the inventory is supported at the moment)[/li] [li]Added in methods to easily set messages unto the welcome screen's message of the week, and a better way to set them[/li] [li]Finished welcome screen implementations. Modified the data packet for it to add the data that was not in there before[/li] [li]Fixed some client crashes[/li] [li]Fixed a bug that wouldn't fully remove a player[/li][/ul] [b]October 5[/b] [ul][li]School kept me busy! Offloaded Item & Object definition loaders to separate threads to save about 3 seconds of startup time[/li][/ul] [b]October 2[/b] [ul][li]Loading the object locations from cache, to allow automated verification of object clicks[/li] [li]Loading all object definitions from cache[/li] [li]Saving player data to MySQL. Only core data, inventory, equipment, and skills are saved presently [list][li]Only data that has changed is saved to the database, to improve performance[/li][/list][/li][/ul] [b]October 1[/b] [ul][li]Add headicon & skull support[/li] [li]Add arrow-above-entity support[/li] [li]Add support for the welcome screen. The client (317) loads 377 cache so fullscreen welcome screens were not natively supported. A 377 deob was used to fix this (along with headicons)[/li][/ul] [b]September 30[/b] [ul][li]Post-processed the item definitions YAML format to JSON for use by the server for much faster loading (~2000 ms to ~500 ms) [list][li]YAML still exists, just kept if it ever needs to be read manually (JSON one is not readable at all :p)[/li][/list][/li] [li]Added every item weight to the item definitions - inventory and worn weights[/li] [li]Added in combat level formula[1][/li] [li]Skills class - removed raw array access for skills. Level ups, combat level ups, and experience gains are broadcasted to scripts[/li] [li]Create tables for player Skills and Attributes[/li][/ul] [b]September 29[/b] [ul][li]Loading of all ItemDefinitions completed (7458 item definitions)[/li] [li]Created new format for Item Definitions: combines items.cfg, stackables.dat and notes.dat[/li] [li]Player attribute system to allow quick temporary settings and long-lived settings that persist between logins.[/li] [li]Completed trading[/li][/ul] [b]September 28[/b] [ul][li]Some of trading completed - scripts/player/Trading.rb[/li] [li]Finished the JRuby scripting implementation - each script is isolated into their own module and can receive events[/li] [li]Loading players from MySQL is almost completed[/li] [li]Created stored procedure to create a player[/li][/ul] [b]September 27[/b] [ul][li]Item security - don't let players pick up items they cannot see (!)[/li] [li]Dropping & picking up items[/li] [li]Ground items[/li] [li]Heavily refactored how inventory storage was done. [list][li]Base Inventory class is shared between Player inventory, Equipment, Shops, Trade windows, etc![/li][/list][/li][/ul] [b]September 26[/b] [ul][li]Created stored procedure to retrieve a player from the database and all of their player data[/li] [li]DatabasePlayerLoader - load players from any JDBC engine (although at the moment it must support Stored Procedures unless it overrides the methods to load/save players!)[/li][/ul] [b]September 24[/b] [ul][li]Finished merging in the OnDemand service to be compatible with this server source. JagGrab is ran independently thus nothing needed to change[/li][/ul] [b]September 23[/b] [ul][li]Full RSA support on both the Client and Server - this means the login block is encrypted using a generated public/private key![/li] [li]Basic friend/ignore list support, nothing awesome just yet.[/li][/ul] [b]August 9[/b] [ul][li]Wrote the JagGrab + OnDemand services. Not part of any server source, completely independent at the time.[/li][/ul]

item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:37, topic:417787”]Nice work with RuneSource Hidendra, how are you finding it’s single threaded performance with the features you’ve implemented? Also I’m guessing the Ruby scripts are interpreted upon load up. I imagine that’s quite lengthy?

Also did you consider converting the protocol to 377 instead of hacking up a 317 client? As I’m sure you know the protocol is very similar.[/quote]
Thanks!

I’m finding performance just fine. JRuby has a slow startup (3-5 seconds for me), but after that the whole Ruby state can be reloaded almost instantaneously (that is, everything scripted on the ruby side can be reloaded instantly.) Speed of going from Java -> Ruby (and even sometimes from Ruby -> Java again) is not very bad at all and has been working wonderfully and works just as if it were pure Java. Any very important logic or framework-y stuff is generally going to stay on the Java side, while Ruby is providing the implementations (although some packets are implemented Ruby-side, and others are on Java, I hope to move them all to the Ruby side at some point.)

As of right now with what I’m implemented there isn’t really anything that uses a lot of CPU - it’s all quite simple. In the future there’ll be a need for work to be done on seperate threads/cpus but of course that isn’t right now (for example, logging queries (which aren’t urgent) will be offloaded to a seperate thread and batched - the server will at some point be logging a lot of data, most likely)

I did run into some minor issues with many clients running concurrently but I may need to write my own (simple, of course) bot that can connect to the server with a large amount of clients (Blitzbot is slow). If I use some other bot utils, I need to disable RSA, welcome screens, etc… Pretty annoying!

I have indeed considered using a different protocol (e.g 377) altogether. I stuck with 317 because so much is already known about it and at the moment it suits my needs (an oldish server like cheezscape + rswiki and you’re good!)

Read full topic

Also did you consider converting the protocol to 377 instead of hacking up a 317 client? As I’m sure you know the protocol is very similar.

item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“Teh_Noob, post:33, topic:417787”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=520330.msg3780847#msg3780847 date=1318462309]

Good luck!

Thanks!

[ul][li]NPCs! RuneSource had a couple bugs where NPCs would both not spawn and refuse to walk. I’ve taught them a couple of lessons, however. :)[/li]
[li]NPC random walking, for those that should roam! Random, too![/li][/ul]

dWHv5.png771×531

All is well! The fine citizens of Gielinor have finally come out of hiding and judging by the enthusiastic guards walking inconspicuously in the background, it appears they are enjoying their time! It appears that a glitch in what must be related to the teleportation matrix has allowed everyone to walk through matter as if it weren’t there! I can assure you however that our finest elves are checking on this strange issue!
[/quote]Why are there random guards in varrock? Anyways… I have a question about your mining. You do have a ‘Rock Delay’ correct? <----- I will dumb it down for the nubs, The rocky thing goes bye bye when you hit it with the big boom boom stick, correct?[/quote]
Yup. And it was a little bug with walking npcs would go further than they were supposed to (not to mention some of the walk range data I had found is wrong, so that may also be part of it.)

The rock that is replaced depends on the location: in Rimmington, the same textured rock is used, otherwise the normal texture is used (the northern wilderness rocks aren’t supported at the moment.) All of mining is scripted, so it’s quite easy:

      :OrelessRock => lambda { |object|
        object > 9000 ? 9724 : 450
      }

uYd6K.png728×443

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote author=Hidendra link=topic=520330.msg3780518#msg3780518 date=1318444732]

I Roll Deep:

Great. I’d like to help you if you want. and for the fullscreen interfaces based on the client, is there something that’s server sided to make the interface loads fullscreen or will it load fullscreen it self?

The 317 client uses one packet for the Welcome Screen - Data for it + Opening it
The 377 client uses three packets: One packet to send Welcome Screen Data, one to open a Fullscreen interface, and another to open a normal interface (which is shown below the welcome screen - the MOTW graphic, the text is set seperate.)

So that’s how I made it do it - I made a different packet to open the welcome screen. e.g:

  # Open the welcome screen
  player.open_welcome_screen

  # Send the message of the week
  player.send_message_of_the_week MOTW_INTERFACES[:VIRUS] , "Welcome to the game!" , "@red@DON'T FUCK UP"

where openWelcomeScreen sends filler data and opens the fullscreen interface

thank yah (;

Read full topic
